channel.title: How do i make it so when a moderator or staff logs in it shows up on chat?
channel.description: please help i wanted to know how i could make it so when someone like astaff logs in it would show on chat like this for example: moderator (Name) has logged in or also change the color of the ::yell color for moderators?

item.title: How do i make it so when a moderator or staff logs in it shows up on chat?
item.dc:creator: @gnomez gnomez
item.description:
@gnomez wrote:

joelx617:

can you be alittle more specific lol sorry i got lost so what should i do im running off the hybrid pvp source?

if thats pi that probably wont work you will need to convert it just find your yell method and make a yell message with the format the void is written in and add it to your login method with what you want it to say then find your playerRights method and add it to your yell message

sorry if thats confusing i cant really explain it better as i have no clue wtf hybrid pvp is

item.source: How do i make it so when a moderator or staff logs in it shows up on chat?

item.title: How do i make it so when a moderator or staff logs in it shows up on chat?
item.dc:creator: @gnomez gnomez
item.description:
@gnomez wrote:

search for l33thax in client.java scroll down to the last l33thax and find your login message add

if(playerRights != 1) {
yell(“Moderator “+playerName+” Has logged in”);
}

you can convert it yourself if it doesent work

change if(playerRights != 1) { to what you want

ie. if(playerRights != 2) { would be admin = 3 would be owner = 0 would be player = 4 would be hidden or donator

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make it so when a moderator or staff logs in it shows up on chat?

item.title: How do i make it so when a moderator or staff logs in it shows up on chat?
item.dc:creator: @Dj_Nm.E Dj Nm.E
item.description:
@Dj_Nm.E wrote:

To change the color of the ::yell should be at commands.java
look for the (yell) command under that has the player,admin,owner,donor.

Read full topic
